examples: He was travelling at a speed of 90 mph.
I get a real thrill from speed.
We were surprised at the speed of the response to our enquiry.

definitions.definition: the rate at which light or sound travels:
examples: The speed of light is 300 million metres per second.

definitions.definition: the rate at which a photographic film absorbs or reacts to light:
examples: What speed film do I need for taking photographs indoors?

definitions.definition: the length of time for which part of a camera is open to allow light to reach the film when a photograph is being taken:
to (cause to) move, go, or happen fast:
examples: The train sped along at over 120 miles per hour.

definitions.definition: to be driving faster than you are legally allowed to do:
